citation.article-title: Paenibacillus turicensis sp. nov., a novel bacterium harbouring heterogeneities between 16S rRNA genes.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus turicensis sp. nov.
Paenibacillus turicensis (tu.ri.cen'sis. L. adj. turicensis of Turicum, the Latin name of Zu$ rich, where the type strain was isolated)
Cells are Gram-positive, motile rods, 1.5-3¬0.5-1 μm in size.
Terminal to subterminal oval spores are formed in swollen sporangia.
On sheep-blood agar, the nonhaemolytic colonies were greyish-white with a convex elevation.
Facultatively anaerobic, growing at 15-48°C and pH 5.5-9.5 with optima of 37-42°C and pH 7.
Doubling time under optimal conditions is 45 min.
Grows in the presence of up to 5% NaCl and 0.1% lysozyme.
Negative for catalase, oxidase, urease, nitrate reduction and indole production.
Positive for bgalactosidase and Voges-Proskauer reaction.

Ferments L-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, methyl β-xyloside, galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, D-raffinose, glycogen, β-gentiobiose and 5-ketogluconate (weak).
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15:0 (41%), C16:0 (25%), C14:0 (9%) and iso-C14:0 (9%).
The bacterium contains at least six to eight 16S rRNA genes.
The 16S rDNA shares 98.5% sequence similarity with Paenibacillus sp. isolate P15-9 and 93.7-87.2% similarity with other paenibacilli.
The type strain is strain MOL722T (=DSM 14349T=NCCB 100011T), which harbours up to 0.77% heterogeneity between 16S rRNA genes, including, among others, an insertion of one nucleotide.
